task_summary: The robot is tasked to pick up the kettle, starting from visual localization, approaching, grasping and lifting the object as evidenced across the contact-sheet frames.

task_long_description.overview: This sequence involves a robot arm detecting and picking up a kettle from a blue surface. The process begins with visual search and localization, followed by approach and alignment over the kettle, preparing the gripper, computing a top-down grasp, and executing a stable grasp. The final step verifies successful lift-off, indicating the kettle is held securely. The contact-sheet frames illustrate the kettle's position and orientation throughout this procedure. Robust perception and compliant interaction are priorities.
preconditions: Kettle is placed upright and visible on a blue surface
No other objects obstruct access to the kettle
stepwise_plan: Check if kettle is visible or initiate a scan
Open the gripper to an appropriate width
Move above the kettle at safe offset
Approach and align with tight tolerance
Lower until gentle contact is detected
success_criteria: Kettle is detected and localized by wrist camera
Gripper successfully closes on kettle handle/body
Object is lifted and remains in gripper
No collision or object slip occurs during manipulation
failure_and_recovery: Object not visible: retry scan up to 3 times
Grasp failure: reopen gripper and repeat approach
False positive grip: abort and retry
task_long_description.termination: Sequence terminates once the kettle is detected in the gripper following closure and lift

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if kettle is visible before scan.
Scans area for kettle if not initially visible.
Detects and localizes kettle for grasp planning.
Moves robotic TCP directly above kettle.
Computes top-down grasp pose for kettle.
Approaches and aligns TCP over kettle with tight tolerance.
Lowers TCP until gentle contact detected with kettle.
Closes gripper to grasp kettle with minimal force.
Confirms kettle is held in gripper after grasp.

recovery_strategy: Rescan for kettle if not visible
Repeat lower and grasp steps on failure
Abort sequence if object remains undetectable after 3 retries
assumptions: Frames show only kettle; no clutter or distractors detected.
Kettle orientation is suitable for top-down grasp, as handle is largely unobstructed.
Instruction matches episode and frames; no visible mismatch.

expected_success_criteria: Kettle lifted and held in gripper.
